text: Male Wistar rats ( 150 g average weight ) were housed under standard conditions and fed ad libitum with standard rodent laboratory chow .
Degraded iota-carrageenans were administered in the drinking water ( 5 % w / v ) for 55 days to 2 groups of six animals each .
The first group received the low molecular weight carrageenan ( 10 kDa dCGN ) and the second received the medium molecular weight carrageenan ( 40 kDa dCGN ) .
An additional group of four rats were maintained on regular tap water ( control group ) .
To increase palatability 0.2 % sucrose was added to the drinking water of all groups ( Van der Waaji et al . , [ 23 ] ) .
Fresh carrageenan solutions were prepared daily .
